results.title: Pilates: intermediate program
results.brief_description: Pilates is an exercise program designed to stretch, strengthen, and balance the body. Poses are systematic and utilise specific breathing techniques that make them extremely effective in encouraging muscle strength and tone. Pilates has been used extensively by dancers and sports professional but is also suitable for persons interested in improving overall fitness. Benefits from practising Pilates include: increased lung capacity, flexibility, improved posture and balance, back strength and muscular definition particularly in the abdominal region. Presented by practitioner Allan Menezes, this disc is designed for those who exercise once or twice a week and wish to improve their overall fitness. Chapters include: introduction and pre-start tips; breathing techniques; starting stretches; hamstring, quad and thigh; rolls/leg circle 100s; single and double leg stretch; criss cross and spine stretch; saw/neck roll single leg kick; swimming rest position; rotation twist jack knife; side leg kick, side leg lift; teaser/teaser twist; side bend seal/hinge, arm weights; tips for pilates. Some poses require the use of props, many of which should be found around the home. Menezes instructs two individuals whilst discussing the poses at length. The disc also contains frequent English subtitles, which pertain to key components of the pose. To reduce the risk of injury, consult your doctor before beginning this or any exercise program.

results.title: Mela's lunch
results.creator_credit: Sugith Varughese, Penny Ritco, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Playing Fair”.
Mela has just immigrated from India to Canada and is trying to settle into a new environment. Finding new friends and getting used to new surroundings becomes difficult because Peter and his classmates are determined to make her feel unwelcome and out of place. They jeer at her because her lunch is different and initially Allison goes along with the group, but realises this is unfair. Her decision to stick by Mela and to get to know her better demonstrate that differences in skin colour and country of origin should not be an obstacle to friendship and self-esteem.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sugith Varughese, Penny Ritco, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Carol's mirror
results.creator_credit: Selwyn Jacob, Penny Ritco, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Playing Fair”.
Nobody wants to play Snow White in this year’s drama production except for Carol. Previous years she had to be content to play lesser roles or the wicked witch. However, for some of her classmates this is a problem, because Carol is not white. After much lively debate and creative thinking, Carol and her classmates find a solution and show that the problem is not Carol’s colour, but that the material itself and people’s expectations about Snow White are the real obstacle.

results.title: Pilates for beginners
results.brief_description: Pilates is an exercise program designed to stretch, strengthen, and balance the body. Poses are systematic and utilise specific breathing techniques that make them extremely effective in encouraging muscle strength and tone. Pilates has been used extensively by dancers and sports professional but is also suitable for persons interested in improving overall fitness. Benefits from practising Pilates include: increased lung capacity, flexibility, improved posture and balance, back strength and muscular definition particularly in the abdominal region. Presented by practitioner Allan Menezes, this disc contains information on poses suitable for people wishing to gain an introduction to Pilates, who may not exercise often. The first chapter is an introduction to the poses and how to correctly perform them in relation to breathing, posture and holding poses. Other chapters focus on: starting stretches; hamstring stretches; thigh stretches; side leg lifts; spine stretches; preparation for the 100s; 100s pose; co-ordination; single leg circle; perfect abdominal curl; arm weights; rest position; and arm swings. Some poses require the use of props, many of which should be found around the home. Menezes instructs two individuals whilst discussing the poses at length. The disc also contains frequent English subtitles, which pertain to key components of the pose. To reduce the risk of injury, consult your doctor before beginning this or any exercise program.

results.title: Pilates advanced program
results.brief_description: Pilates is an exercise program designed to stretch, strengthen, and balance the body. Poses are systematic and utilise specific breathing techniques that make them extremely effective in encouraging muscle strength and tone. Pilates has been used extensively by dancers and sports professional but is also suitable for persons interested in improving overall fitness. Benefits from practising Pilates include: increased lung capacity, flexibility, improved posture and balance, back strength and muscular definition particularly in the abdominal region. Presented by practitioner Allan Menezes, this disc is designed for those who are fit and strong and would like a challenge to their current fitness program. Chapters include: introduction and pre-start tips; breathing techniques; rollup/hundreds/roll over; single leg circles rolling like a ball; single and double leg stretch; criss cross spine stretch; open leg rocker/corkscrew; saw/neck rolls; swan 1 and 2; single and double leg kicks; swimming/breast stroke; neck pull/bicycle/scissors; shoulder bridge; rotation twist jack knife; leg kicks/teaser lower and raise; leg pull front and back; side twist/boomerang/racking; rest position/push ups; cool down/arm swings. Some poses require the use of props, many of which should be found around the home. Menezes instructs two individuals whilst discussing the poses at length. The disc also contains frequent English subtitles, which pertain to key components of the pose. To reduce the risk of injury, consult your doctor before beginning this or any exercise program.

results.title: Playing Beatie Bow
results.brief_description: The game is called Beatie Bow and the children play it for the thrill of scaring themselves. When Abigail is drawn in, the game is quickly transformed into an extraordinary adventure when she realises that somehow, through some eerie time shift, she had arrived in “The Rocks” of one hundred years ago. Stars Peter Phelps and Nikki Coghill. Based on the novel by Ruth Park.

results.title: Playgrounds for free
results.brief_description: Shows the construction of more than a dozen community built playgrounds throughout Pennsylvania under a special playground program. Shows how to use old tyres, oil drums, cable reels and other used materials. Tells how to assess resources, and puts the problem of vandalism in perspective.

results.title: Playground (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David Grieve, Torben Strandgaard and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description: Employs live action, still photographs, animation and split frame techniques to show how creative playgrounds provide opportunities for children to build their own play environments and enjoy their creations in a non-regimented atmosphere.

results.title: Play to learn
results.creator_credit: Joe Bas, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This film shows how Julius Erdelyi, a teacher at Woodlands School, New Westminster, prepares children for real-life situations outside the classroom - walking through downtown traffic, for instance. He brings in actual traffic lights and follows this up with field trips. The children suffer from varying degrees of being mentally handicapped, but they all obviously welcome such opportunities to learn and grow.

results.title: Play School. The road show
results.brief_description: Five Play School presenters sing songs, tell stories and play games about cars, buses and bikes - and about how to be safe on the road. Presenters include Benita Collings, John Hamblin, Noni Hazelhurst, Simon Burke, George Spartels.
